Forty miles outside of Kabul in the village of Sausang, about 20 Afghan men gather in a concrete and mud house.
They are the elders, the clerics, the most respected members of the community.

(SOUNDBITE OF CROWD CHATTERING)
On this day, they're hearing a case about an uncle and his nephew, whose bitter and sometimes violent land dispute has divided the family for a year.
